title: We a need a huge ranked system overhaul
body:
The end of the season is approaching and I remember riot stating they will make some changes to the promos system.

However, I personally think the ranked system as a whole needs a complete overhaul. Here is why:
____


Rank is supposed to show how far you have come as an individual in the game. As much as we would hate to admit it, we always see players skill mostly through their rank. For example, we would much rather have a diamond player on our team than a bronze 5 player. This is of course, understandable because to our eyes the diamond player is much more experienced. This is ok, in fact the system of having ranks such as gold plat diamond, that system is fine. However, the system of how you're supposed to GET to those ranks is completely and utterly wrong and frankly, outdated.
Let's take the example of tests in school. All of us know that these teachers can not determine our actual knowledge solely on tests. I remember reading an article the other day where the author wrote something interesting. He said, "How are we supposed to understand the level of knowledge in our children when the level of knowledge we are teaching them is how to take tests." He continued by stating, "If we are teaching our children to take tests, then how are they going to be ready for the real world? We should be teaching them how to sustain a lifestyle, not how to get an A+ on a piece of paper." (Please note that these are rough interpretations from my own memory as i could not find the official source) 
I could not agree more with his notion, and with that system in place, children are not being taught how they should and want to be. Now then, if we were to take that same example, and apply to ranked matches, we would have a similar case. Before i continue i do want to state that League of Legends is definitely and without a doubt a team driven game, however the word 'team' only reaches so far to many people. **It comes to a point where your 'team' was a sole reason you went down in rank, or, in the same sense, went up in ranked.**

I believe that your rank should be based on YOUR level of skill, rather than mostly other teammates. Of course, in a team 5v5 ranked match, all numbers should be calculated as a whole. However, when it comes to solo que ranked, numbers NEED to be arranged in a different manner, only because the rank at hand, belongs to a certain individual. That is the word isn't it... **Individual**... that will be the main idea of my argument here, that will be the word that brings all my ideas together.
___
**Solo que**: You take on the task of being paired with people you know nothing about. All you have are your first impressions on them and that's it. You don't know what kind of life they've had, or what they have been through, but that is what it is. What you depend on is trying to work with these people to secure a win, why? Because your rank depends on it. Most of the time, and definitely NOT always, you take on an artificial friendship for these people JUST to get on their good side, and JUST to keep them happy, keep them focused, in the sole hope that you can get them to play their best. You fear the moment one of them begin to argue, you fear the moment the peace you tried so hard to sustain is broken because of one of them dying. You fear THE MOST, one of them becoming a troll, or going afk, because it is at that moment, you know you lost that match, or rather, YOU didn't lose that match, that person did, for everyone. Everyone suffers the consequence that SHOULD have been bestowed on the one who deserved it. In the end, you suffered for the actions of someone else, and that should never happen.

We have an excellent system implemented to our game recently, the champion mastery system. Our performance with our champion is taken and transformed into a Letter, a letter that shows us how much farther we have gotten, or need to go. Because getting an S+ with a champion, gives you the feeling of 'i did it'. I believe this system should have been taken, and in-cooperated heavily in the ranked system. You wouldn't want to be arrested because you were with someone who shot another person, because you didn't do it, he did. In the same sense, you shouldn't be stuck in bronze/silver/gold/plat because someone else decided to screw you over, you were innocent, you did not deserve to get punished. Because in the end, our rank should be a manifestation of our OWN performance, because in the end, we are **Individuals** and we should not be calculated based on the actions of others. 

Thank you for reading...

But we need to be scored on how we perform in a teamwork-based environment. If you cannot cooperate with others, then how do you expect to win team games?

And how would we score individual performance? If we focused on solo carry play, then the problem with "bad teams" (I quote other players on this, since I believe that you should focus on the common denominator first) will only get worse as people rage and focus on their cs and KDA.

Mastery is a poor judge, as you gain highest level regardless 'skill'. Right now it's a glorified participant award.

If Riot wants it to work, players should only gain point as their performance improve (i.e. only A and above would contribute point once someone is rank 3+ and lose point if they get a C, etc) and it should only work in ranked.

Obviously you wouldn't want to use the exact Mastery system as it is now.  Instead, you would tweak it a little.  The points you gain from mastery weren't even what was mentioned, it was the letter grade you got.  

Honestly, the biggest flaw I see with the current ranked system is that you just flat-out lose or gain a huge chunk of points regardless of how well you did in the game.  If you lost the game but went 17/3/7, you shouldn't lose 17-22 points purely because you lost.  If you won but went 1/11/6, you shouldn't still gain a bunch of points purely because you won.  It just makes it needlessly harder to at the very least maintain your rank if you have a string of bad games and easier to just have a platinum smurf friend carry you out of your rank.  Not to mention it makes it far more difficult for support players to carry themselves out of lower ranks as well.

Wow such a long post holy shit.

But I read it and agree with every word.

My theory is that a not-insignificant number of games are decided by toxic players.
Players who troll, go AFK, spend more time flaming than playing, are constantly negative and trying to lose because they don't think they can win, etc.
We've all come across players like this.  They're not in every game, but they're still relatively common.  (At a conservative guess, I'd say that about ~10% of games are decided by toxicity instead of skill - since there are highly toxic players in roughly 20% of games.)

In order for matchmaking based on win/loss to work, then skill and teamwork need to be the only factors which decide the outcome of the game.
For every game which is decided by a single toxic player, turning what should have been a win for a team into a loss for that team, the matchmaking system becomes slightly less aligned.
This means that sometimes a player may end up significantly higher or lower than they belong.   In turn, that can cause two things:

 - A game where one player plays much worse than everyone else.
 - A game where one player plays much better than everyone else, potentially stomping on the enemy team.

This can lead to more undeserved wins/losses because of the skill gap, but also increases frustration for the other players in the game, possibly leading the to those players being more likely to be toxic in their next game because of the bad experience, which in turn disrupts even more of the matchmaking.

I want the Ranked system to judge me off of my own skill, but I have an issue.

When I first played Ranked I did terribly and only won 3/10 of my placement games. I didn't do that bad personally, but I didn't do that great. This was my fault for playing Ranked probably a few weeks after I hit level 30 when I clearly wasn't ready and still a bad player. Either way I got Silver 5 anyways and was happy I didn't get stuck in Bronze.

Recently I started playing Ranked again and I've pretty much won all but 2 games, and have gotten fed every game but one I've played. I do extremely well and have relatively no issue with solo carrying my team.

My main issue is that, if I'm playing bad in Ranked, stop, and come back and I'm significantly better, I want the system to recognize that and sort of forget my older, worse statistics. Some may disagree but this would be a huge concern about the system. I don't want to spend all of these games in a tier that I constantly get fed in and win almost every game in. I think if I win 6 - 10 games in a row at a time, all of them where I can extremely fed, I think the system should consider at least skipping divisions or making it less time-consuming to rank up in ranks that are very easy. Right now Ranked doesn't feel difficult, but it feels extremely time consuming. I don't think that's how Ranked should be, the division you're in should always be a challenge and not just you spending 20 - 40 minutes solo carrying your team, going 20-0,  while simultaneously on Twitter and Instagram.
